oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of Benjamin Franklin Sheppard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Benjamin Franklin Sheppard of Monroe, La. He enlisted in the 4th La. Inf. Battn., CSA and was discharged in 1861 by surgeon's certificate. He later enlisted in the 13th La. Partisan Ranger Battn., CSA and was captured. The prison train was derailed; in Sumner County, Tenn. He then joined Ellis Harper's Indep. Scouts Co., CSA. After the war he married Eudora Jane Fitts of Templo, Tenn. They lived near Hartsville, Trousdale County, Tenn. Both are buried in the Gallatin City Cemetery.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheppard, Benjamin Franklin
